result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel R Dreksler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: --pay a fine of $500  + costs = $1158 +472.50 drug abuse surcharge =$1630.50, to be paid in $50 per month installments commencing on 4/16/15 and on the 16th day of each month thereafter until paid in full. Non-payment shall result in a 32 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive.

Case called at 3:38pm [mo]
Defendant Daniel R Dreksler in court with Attorney Bradley J Jansen.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Mr.Dreksler waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.
The Court finds that Mr. Dreksler is a repeater

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses: Count #2

On Count #1 the Court sentences the Defendant to:
--pay a fine of $500  + costs = $1158 +472.50 drug abuse surcharge =$1630.50, to be paid in $50 per month installments commencing on 4/16/15 and on the 16th day of each month thereafter until paid in full. Non-payment shall result in a 32 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive.
 
recess:4:05pm
Status conference on March 16, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on February 25, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Scheduling Notice

case called at 3:08pm. [MK]
Defendant Daniel R Dreksler in court with Attorney Bradley J. Jansen.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
The Court discloses that a conflict review was done and that it was noted that Mr. Dreksler had a 2009 forfeiture matter, however the Court notes that it left its position as then-District Attorney in 2008.

Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.
Mr. Dreksler verifies that the W1366 Fairview Rd, Genoa City address is current. 
recess 3:11pm.

Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

case called at 1:16pm. [MK]
Defendant Daniel R Dreksler in court.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
In response to the Court's inquiry about why Mr. Dreksler is appearing today without counsel, Mr. Dreksler cites his work and childcare schedules, and his lack of transportation as reasons for not having the ability to apply at the Jefferson Public Defenders Office.  
The Court finds that Mr. Dreksler has not forfeited his right to counsel, but not making efforts today to retain counsel. 
The Court amends the bond to add the condition:  to go to the Jefferson Public Defender's Office to apply for representation today.  
recess 1:20pm. 

NEXT:   Adjourned Initial Appearance on 2/10/15 at 3:00pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on January 20, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

case called at 1:24pm. [MK]
Defendant Daniel R Dreksler in court.  ADA Theresa Beck  appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Mr. Dreksler provides a new address of 896 S. Franklin Street, Lot #4 in Whitewater WI. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the felony charge and maximum penalties are recited
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given
Mr. Dreksler requests adjournment so that he can seek representation by counsel. 

The Court requires a $500   Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
--no possession of drug paraphernalia 
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department today for booking
recess 1:30pm.

NEXT:   Adjourned Initial Appearance on 1/20/15 at 1:00pm.
